data.title: Minnesota Landscape Arboretum
data.text:
Due to the Taste & Toast event, the Arboretum will close at 1 p.m. on Wednesday, July 31. The last available ticket is for 11:30 a.m. and the last tram ride will be at noon. Thanks for your understanding!

Discover what's blooming at the Arboretum with Garden Highlights which is updated weekly. Follow us on social media for the most up-to-date information before your next visit.

Drop-in between 10 a.m.-2 p.m. on Saturdays now through Aug. 31, for free family-friendly activities on the Farm! Celebrate the unfolding harvest season, the work of Minnesota farmers and the plant-to-plate story with a new theme each week. Learn more

Get a look at how honey is harvested and bottled at the Tashjian Bee and Pollinator Discovery Center on Aug. 2 and Aug. 3! Watch through the viewing windows as the beekeeper harvests this year's honey from the hives. Learn more about the harvest

Discover the Harrison Sculpture Garden through a self-guided audio tour. You can visit each piece in order, or walk straight to the sculpture that catches your eye. This is a great way to learn more about iconic art at the Arboretum!

Discover what's unfolding with our newly refreshed blog! We're delighted to share that the Arboretum’s Nature Notes blog has moved to a new home on the Arboretum’s website. Check out the blog

Check out our new 50-page, spiral-bound Arboretum Guidebook that is now for sale in the Gift & Garden Store for $12.99. This book is a great souvenir, but also an incredibly useful resource. Learn more about the guidebook

It's growing season! Whether you’re looking to troubleshoot a plant problem, find the perfect plants for your garden, learn about lawn care or Ask a Master Gardener, we can help with these resources

The Arboretum is currently hiring for a variety of positions. Join a dedicated team of nature enthusiasts who work to educate and inspire the greater community.

Use our digital map to easily navigate our magnificent gardens, tree collections, model landscapes and more. If you're looking for a hard copy, stop in the Oswald Visitor Center or print your own.
